fields.summary: Cluster controller should not parse network information in VPC mode

status.description: This issue is undergoing QA.  See linked QA issue(s) for progress.
status.name: In QA

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:
When there are many instances running (~7000 in this case) the cluster controller delays sending the network view to the nodes for too long (several minutes)

The cluster controller CPU use is high during the delay:

{code}
# top
top - 18:48:51 up 11 days, 18:11,  1 user,  load average: 1.20, 1.11, 1.08
Tasks: 414 total,   2 running, 412 sleeping,   0 stopped,   0 zombie
Cpu(s):  6.3%us,  0.0%sy,  0.0%ni, 93.7%id,  0.0%wa,  0.0%hi,  0.0%si,  0.0%st
Mem:  65956832k total,  4590192k used, 61366640k free,   167756k buffers
Swap:  2097148k total,        0k used,  2097148k free,  3354824k cached

  PID USER      PR  NI  VIRT  RES  SHR S %CPU %MEM    TIME+  COMMAND                                                                                                                                    
 7859 eucalypt  20   0 2884m 1.9g 1.8g R 100.0  3.0   1190:25 httpd                                                                                                                                     
11731 root      20   0 15300 1496  924 R  0.3  0.0   0:00.31 top                                                                                                                                        
    1 root      20   0 19364 1540 1228 S  0.0  0.0   0:39.05 init   
{code}

stack dumps during the period of high CPU usage:

{code}

If a few instances are launched with a small delay between each it can be the case that some instances information will take over 10 minutes to reach the node controller after being sent from the cloud controller.
fields.summary: EC2 network view propagation to node controller is delayed

comments.body: Blue Team is looking at GNI propagation scalability.
There is some handling of the GNI inside the CC. Need to determine if that is still necessary post-4.2 as it looks like it was supplanted in the refactor work the Chuck did for Managed*.

The GNI processing is to identify EIPs assigned to instances and call AssignAddress on each applicable NC to populate the public IP in the instance for inclusion in DescribeInstances responses from the NC->CC->CLC. [~sjones], it looks like this instance->pub_ip mapping is used in the instance restore logic in the CLC. Is it still strictly necessary, or can we remove some of the instance restore logic that restores network allocations and rely only on restore modes that do not require network knowledge? Such a change would remove the requirement for this mapping to be held in the NCs and thereby also remove the need for any GNI processing in the CC.
We need the feedback on when public addresses are no longer used so we can track when to include any replacement address assignment in the network broadcast.

Ok, it's also possible for the NC to parse the GNI and invoke the AssignAddress() call locally, that would push the computation to the NCs rather than the CC, and that work could be done asynchronously. I'll explore that option as well.
